revised_title: Two-Body Interactions of Small Uniform Spheres in Dilute Suspensions
tldr: The authors studied the interactions of small uniform spheres in dilute suspensions undergoing Poiseuille flow. They found that the collision frequency and the number of steady-state doublets were similar to those observed in Couette flow. The results provide insights into suspension rheology and have implications for various problems, including blood flow, latexes, pulp fiber suspensions, and molten polymers.
